article.title: Structure of the Entanglement Entropy of (3+1)D Gapped Phases of Matter

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements correctly describes Figure 1?
choices: It depicts a sphere S<sup>2</sup> divided into three regions.
It illustrates the Kitaev-Preskill-Levin-Wen (KPLW) prescription for an entanglement surface of a torus T<sup>2</sup>.
It shows a torus T<sup>2</sup> where regions A, B, and C are each non-orientable surfaces.
It represents a three-dimensional system with a single entanglement cut.
The topology of a 2-sphere S<sup>2</sup> as the boundary of a 3-ball B<sup>3</sup>.
The dual lattice configuration of the A field in spacetime.
The topology of spacetime M<sup>4</sup> and space S<sup>3</sup>, with S<sup>3</sup> being the spatial slice boundary of M<sup>4</sup>.
The configuration of occupied bonds forming a loop in the dual lattice of S<sup>3</sup>.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which statement accurately describes the relationship between the original lattice and the dual lattice depicted in Figure 3?
choices: The 2-simplex (ijk) in the original lattice is dual to the 2-simplex (ab) in the dual lattice.
The dual lattice 1-simplices are represented by solid lines.
The orientation of the dual-lattice 1-simplices is opposite to the orientation of the original lattice 2-simplices.
The 2-simplex (ijk) in the original lattice is dual to the 1-simplex (ab) in the dual lattice.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of Figure 4?
choices: To illustrate a 3-dimensional system where B = Ï€ on all simplices.
To demonstrate the loop condensation of the ground state wavefunction.
To show an example of the microscopic structure of a spatial partitioning with an entanglement cut in (2+1)D.
To highlight the difference between a BF theory and a GWW model.
The full entanglement entropy for various GWW models.
The area law coefficient for different entanglement surfaces.
The constant part and the topological entanglement entropy (TEE) for BF and GWW models across different entanglement surfaces.
The dependence of the EE on the regularization scheme.
